channel.title: CVE Feed for Nozomi Networks -- Guardian
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Nozomi Networks -- Guardian

item.title: CVE-2023-22843|2024-09-03T19:59:30.398Z -- nozomi%20networks -- guardian
item.description: An authenticated attacker with administrative access to the appliance can inject malicious JavaScript code inside the definition of a Threat Intelligence rule, that will later be executed by another legitimate user viewing the details of such a rule. An attacker may be able to perform unauthorized actions on behalf of legitimate users. JavaScript injection was possible in the content for Yara rules, while limited HTML injection has been proven for packet and STYX rules. The injected code will be executed in the context of the authenticated victim's session.

item.title: CVE-2024-0218|2024-08-01T17:41:16.232Z -- nozomi%20networks -- guardian
item.description:
A Denial of Service (Dos) vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian, caused by improper input validation in certain fields used in the Radius parsing functionality of our IDS, allows an unauthenticated attacker sending specially crafted malformed network packets to cause the IDS module to stop updating nodes, links, and assets.
Network traffic may not be analyzed until the IDS module is restarted.

item.title: CVE-2023-6916|2024-05-28T12:30:45.201Z -- nozomi%20networks -- guardian
item.description:
Audit records for OpenAPI requests may include sensitive information.
This could lead to unauthorized accesses and privilege escalation.
